pullRequest.body:
---

Please doublecheck whether I used `@[ext]` correctly.

nodes.body:
### PR summary [3f38784d73](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19664/commits/3f38784d73a43ad40edb98846d8c972e4cc05d72)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ ext_base`
`+ ext_base_indep`
`+ ext_iff_base`
`+ ext_iff_indep`
`+ ext_indep`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
LGTM

Maybe also add this one: 
```
/-- If every base of `M₁` is independent in `M₂` and vice versa, then `M₁ = M₂`. -/
lemma ext_base_indep {M₁ M₂ : Matroid α} (hE : M₁.E = M₂.E) (h₁ : ∀ ⦃B⦄, M₁.Base B → M₂.Indep B)
    (h₂ : ∀ ⦃B⦄, M₂.Base B → M₁.Indep B) : M₁ = M₂ := by
  refine ext_indep hE fun I hIE ↦ ⟨fun hI ↦ ?_, fun hI ↦ ?_⟩
  · obtain ⟨B, hB, hIB⟩ := hI.exists_base_superset
    exact (h₁ hB).subset hIB
  obtain ⟨B, hB, hIB⟩ := hI.exists_base_superset
  exact (h₂ hB).subset hIB
```
A post in zulip PR reviews channel could maybe give this PR a nudge.
For the sake of getting this PR reviewed, I suggest keeping it as as it is a `chore` PR and later create a `feature` PR with the additional lemmas.
Ooooops I already added `ext_iff_base` last week. Should I remove it from this PR, too?

> Maybe also add this one:


Since nobody was reviewing this PR anyways, I added the new lemma.
Can you please add deprecated aliases for the old names?
Sorry, I always forget to do it.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12493610757/job/34862251158)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12493610757/job/34862251381)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
Perhaps `∀ ⦃I⦄, I ⊆ M.E → _` instead (and also in the `iff` version)? To match with `ext_base`.

Maybe add an `iff` version too: 

```
theorem ext_iff_base {M₁ M₂ : Matroid α} :
    M₁ = M₂ ↔ M₁.E = M₂.E ∧ ∀ ⦃B⦄, B ⊆ M₁.E → (M₁.Base B ↔ M₂.Base B) :=
  ⟨fun h ↦ by simp [h], fun ⟨hE, h⟩ ↦ ext_base hE h⟩

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(Data/Matroid): refactoring ext lemmas
